label: Customer Journey Mapping
description: Automatically discovers and visualizes actual customer paths through behavioral data analysis, identifying friction points and prioritizing improvements by ROI.

traditionalApproach.description: Quarterly workshops with static journey maps stored in PowerPoint
characteristics: Quarterly workshops with cross-functional teams
Sticky notes and whiteboard diagrams
Static journey maps stored in PowerPoint
Limited to known/designed journeys
Manual updates when journeys change
constraints: No visibility into actual customer behavior

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers struggle to understand why customers abandon carts at different stages of the journey, leading to $18B annual lost revenue from incomplete purchases. (Source: Salesforce Commerce Cloud Report)

agenticApproach.description: Real-time journey maps auto-generated from behavior with ML-based friction detection and ROI-prioritized improvements
characteristics: Continuous analysis of behavioral data identifies actual paths
ML-based friction detection at drop-off points and delays
Automated ROI scoring ranks improvements by impact
Real-time journey visualizations auto-generated from data
Proactive alerts when new friction patterns emerge
benefits: Real-time journey maps vs quarterly static snapshots
Discovers actual customer paths vs designed assumptions
Automated friction detection vs manual analysis
ROI-prioritized improvements vs gut-feel decisions
Continuous monitoring vs periodic updates

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can identify and eliminate friction points in multi-step booking processes, reducing abandonment rates by 25-35% through journey-based improvements. (Source: Expedia Group Travel Industry Report)

quickWins: Deploy auto-discovery for top 3 customer journeys (checkout, search, returns)
Implement friction detection on mobile checkout flow
Enable real-time journey dashboards for product and CX teams
prerequisites: Clickstream analytics infrastructure (Google Analytics 4, Adobe Analytics)
Session replay tool (Hotjar, FullStory, LogRocket)
Clean customer identifier across channels
Historical behavior data (3-6 months minimum)
Defined business metrics (conversion, satisfaction, revenue)

activities: Implement clickstream analytics and session recording tools
Establish unified customer identity across digital channels
Deploy journey mapping for 3-5 critical customer flows
Create basic friction detection rules (drop-off rates, time delays)
outcomes: Real-time visibility into actual customer journeys vs assumptions
Identification of top 5 friction points causing abandonment
Cross-functional alignment on customer experience priorities
prerequisites: Digital analytics platform (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
Customer data platform or unified customer profile
Session recording and heatmapping tools
Cross-functional CX team (product, design, marketing)

activities: Implement ML-based journey discovery and clustering
Deploy automated friction detection using behavioral signals
Integrate journey insights with product roadmap and testing
Establish continuous journey monitoring and alerting
Expand to omnichannel journey mapping (online + offline)
outcomes: ML-powered discovery of hidden journey patterns and segments
Automated identification of friction points with impact quantification
Journey-based A/B testing framework for optimization
Predictive journey analytics for proactive improvements
prerequisites: Successful journey mapping from Crawl phase
ML/AI capabilities for pattern recognition
Integration with A/B testing and experimentation platforms
Product management processes for journey-driven development
Offline channel data integration (POS, call center)

activities: Implement predictive journey modeling and simulation
Create self-service journey analytics for all teams
Establish journey intelligence as core business capability
Integrate with strategic planning and innovation processes
outcomes: Autonomous journey optimization driving continuous improvements
Predictive journey modeling for strategic decision-making
Journey intelligence embedded in all customer-facing processes
prerequisites: Mature journey analytics from Walk phase
Advanced AI/ML platform for autonomous optimization
Enterprise-wide adoption of journey-driven processes
Integration with strategic planning and innovation frameworks
Executive commitment to customer-centric transformation

keyTechnologyPartners.name: Google Analytics 4
keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: Event-based tracking and journey analysis across digital touchpoints

keyTechnologyPartners.name: Adobe Analytics
keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: Advanced journey analytics and customer segmentation

keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: Visual journey mapping and friction point identification

keyTechnologyPartners.name: FullStory
keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: Session replay and automated friction detection

keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: In-app journey analytics and user experience insights

keyTechnologyPartners.name: WalkMe
keyTechnologyPartners.useCase: Guided journeys and in-app user assistance

label: Omnichannel Orchestration
description: Maintains seamless customer experience across channels with synchronized state, intelligent routing, and consistent personalization.

traditionalApproach.description: Separate channel teams with no state synchronization or cross-channel awareness
characteristics: Separate teams manage web, mobile, in-store experiences
Cart doesn't sync across channels
Customer must restart journey when switching channels
No awareness of cross-channel behavior
constraints: Customer frustration from repeated information entry
No visibility into customer's cross-channel journey
Fragmented customer data across channel silos

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers cannot track customer journeys that start on mobile apps and complete in stores, leading to inaccurate measurement of marketing ROI and suboptimal channel investments. (Source: Adobe Experience Cloud Report)

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Cross-channel cart abandonment studies']

agenticApproach.description: Seamless handoffs between channels with instant cart sync, unified messaging, and consistent personalization everywhere
characteristics: Context handoff maintains cart, browsing history, preferences across channels
Intelligent routing directs customer to optimal channel for their need
Unified messaging coordinates email, SMS, push, in-app notifications
Cross-channel personalization ensures consistent experience
Real-time customer state synchronization (<1 second)
benefits: Seamless channel transitions vs fragmented experiences
Cart sync prevents abandonment
Customer never repeats information across channels
Consistent personalization everywhere vs channel-specific
Significant reduction in channel-switch abandonment

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can maintain booking context across devices and channels, reducing booking abandonment by 40% when customers switch from mobile research to desktop purchase. (Source: Travelport Technology Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on seamless cart preservation across channels eliminating re-entry friction']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on context handoff maintaining customer journey state across channels']

quickWins: Deploy cart sync between web and mobile app
Implement unified messaging for transactional notifications
Enable context handoff for top 3 customer journeys
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform (CDP) or unified customer profile
Shared session management across channels
API-first architecture for channel integrations
Single customer identifier across all channels
Real-time event streaming infrastructure

label: Experience Testing & Optimization
description: Accelerates experimentation with AI-designed tests, continuous statistical monitoring, and automated winner rollouts.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual A/B testing with weeks-long cycles and limited concurrent experiments
characteristics: Manual A/B test design and implementation
Weeks to set up and run experiments
Limited test capacity (1-2 concurrent tests)
Statistical analysis in spreadsheets
No automated winner declaration
constraints: Limited testing throughput constrains learning velocity
No early stopping wastes traffic on losing variants

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers cannot rapidly test personalized product recommendations and pricing across customer segments, limiting the ability to optimize conversion rates through targeted experiences. (Source: Monetate Personalization Report)

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'A/B testing program benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Manual A/B testing capacity limits']

agenticApproach.description: Tests designed and launched in hours with 10+ concurrent experiments, auto-declared winners, and gradual rollouts
characteristics: AI suggests test hypotheses from analytics insights
Multi-variate test design with automated traffic allocation
Continuous Bayesian monitoring with early stopping
Automated winner declaration when significance reached
Gradual rollout monitors for unexpected effects
10+ concurrent experiments without resource constraints
benefits: Tests launched rapidly vs weeks-long cycles
Multiple concurrent experiments vs limited capacity
Automated winner declaration vs manual analysis
Early stopping saves traffic
Gradual rollouts minimize risk of negative impact
Dramatic increase in learning velocity

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can run automated experiments on pricing strategies, demand-based promotions, and package bundling, increasing revenue by 8-12% through optimized pricing experimentation. (Source: Sabre Travel Technology Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on AI-powered test design and automated implementation']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on automated orchestration removing manual resource constraints']

TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on faster test cycles and higher concurrent experiment capacity']

quickWins: Deploy feature flag platform for gradual rollouts
Implement Bayesian monitoring for top 3 experiments
Enable AI test hypothesis generation from analytics
prerequisites: A/B testing platform (Optimizely, VWO, LaunchDarkly)
Statistical analysis engine or library
Feature flag infrastructure for gradual rollouts

label: Voice of Customer (VoC) Intelligence
description: Aggregates and analyzes customer feedback from all sources with NLP-powered sentiment analysis, theme extraction, and impact quantification.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual analysis of disconnected feedback sources with monthly reporting
characteristics: Survey responses analyzed manually
Support tickets categorized by agents
Reviews monitored via alerts
Insights shared in monthly reports
Disconnected from product roadmap
constraints: Weeks-long delay from feedback to insight
Insights not actionable or routed to owners
Limited to samples vs complete feedback corpus

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers struggle to respond to thousands of product reviews and social media mentions in a timely manner, leading to negative sentiment amplification and lost sales opportunities. (Source: Bazaarvoice Social Commerce Report)

agenticApproach.description: Real-time sentiment tracking with automated theme detection, business impact quantification, and targeted insight distribution
characteristics: NLP analyzes surveys, reviews, social, support tickets in real-time
Automated theme extraction identifies pain points and feature requests
Impact quantification connects themes to churn, NPS, revenue
Intelligent routing distributes insights to relevant teams and PMs
Unified feedback corpus across all sources
benefits: Real-time feedback analysis vs monthly batches
100% feedback corpus analyzed vs manual samples
Automated theme detection vs manual categorization
Quantified business impact vs qualitative reports
Insights routed to owners vs broadcast reports
Product roadmap informed by customer voice

contextualBenefits.content: Hotels can automatically detect and respond to negative reviews and feedback within minutes, improving guest satisfaction scores by 15-20% through proactive service recovery. (Source: ReviewPro Hospitality Technology Report)

quickWins: Deploy NLP sentiment analysis for support tickets and reviews
Implement theme extraction for survey open-ended responses
Connect VoC themes to churn data for impact scoring
prerequisites: Aggregated feedback sources (surveys, reviews, social, support)
NLP engine (cloud APIs or open source)
Customer success metrics (NPS, churn, satisfaction)
Product management workflow tool for insight routing
Historical feedback data for ML model training

label: Next Best Action (NBA)
description: Delivers real-time personalized recommendations across all channels using propensity models, offer optimization, and channel selection.

traditionalApproach.description: Generic segment-based campaigns with no real-time decisioning
characteristics: Generic marketing campaigns to segments
Same offer to all customers in segment
No real-time decisioning
Limited to email/display channels
constraints: Batch campaigns lack timeliness and relevance
No cross-channel orchestration (email siloed from app)

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers cannot identify and act on cross-sell opportunities after purchase, missing 20-30% of potential additional revenue from related product recommendations. (Source: Salesforce Retail Cloud Report)

agenticApproach.description: Real-time personalized actions across all channels with propensity-driven targeting, optimized offers, and multi-touch orchestration
characteristics: Propensity models predict likelihood for buy, churn, upsell per customer
Offer optimization selects best message/incentive per individual
Channel selection determines optimal channel and timing
Multi-touch orchestration coordinates campaigns across channels
Real-time decisioning at every customer touchpoint
benefits: Individual-level personalization vs segment averages
Real-time decisioning vs batch campaigns
Response rates dramatically increase through propensity targeting
Optimized offers maximize conversion and margin
Coordinated multi-touch campaigns vs siloed channels
Significant lift in campaign ROI

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can recommend and sell travel insurance, seat upgrades, and add-on services at optimal moments in the customer journey, increasing ancillary revenue by 25-35%. (Source: Amadeus Travel Technology Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on propensity-driven individual targeting vs generic segment campaigns']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on optimized offers and multi-touch orchestration']

quickWins: Deploy propensity models for churn and upsell on top customer segment
Implement offer optimization for email campaigns
Enable channel selection (email vs SMS vs push) based on engagement
prerequisites: Customer Data Platform with unified profiles
ML platform for propensity model training and serving
Marketing automation with API for real-time decisioning
Channel APIs (email, SMS, push, in-app)
Historical campaign response data for ML training

label: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) Optimization
description: Predicts individual customer value in real-time, identifies churn risk early, and orchestrates proactive retention and growth campaigns.

traditionalApproach.description: Historical CLV calculated annually with reactive churn management
characteristics: Historical CLV calculated annually
Segment-level averages
Not used in real-time decisions
Reactive churn management
constraints: Annual CLV refresh too slow for operational use
Segment averages miss individual customer dynamics
Churn managed reactively after customer leaves

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers lose customers from loyalty programs due to irrelevant rewards and poor personalization, with 70% of loyalty members citing lack of value as the reason for inactivity. (Source: Bond Loyalty Report)

agenticApproach.description: Individual CLV predicted in real-time with proactive churn prevention and automated growth campaigns
characteristics: Real-time individual CLV forecasting updated continuously
Churn prediction identifies at-risk customers 30-60 days early
Automated win-back campaigns orchestrated for at-risk customers
Growth opportunity agent identifies upsell/cross-sell by customer
CLV-based decisioning in marketing, support, service
benefits: Real-time individual CLV vs annual segment averages
Proactive churn prevention vs reactive win-back
Early warning system vs post-churn detection
Automated retention campaigns vs manual outreach
Significant churn reduction through early intervention
Growth opportunities surfaced proactively

contextualBenefits.content: Travel companies can predict optimal membership tier upgrades and retention strategies, increasing lifetime value by 40-60% through personalized loyalty program management. (Source: IdeaWorks Travel Loyalty Report)

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML models detecting behavioral signals before churn decision']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on proactive intervention enabling retention before customer decides to leave']

quickWins: Deploy churn prediction model for subscription customers
Implement automated win-back campaigns for at-risk segment
Enable CLV scoring for customer service prioritization
prerequisites: Historical customer transaction data (12-24 months)
Customer behavior data (engagement, support, channel activity)
ML platform for model training and real-time scoring
Campaign automation for retention workflows
Defined churn definition and business rules
